Pre-Game Insights: Orlando Magic aim to build momentum after ending a five-game losing streak with a win against the New Orleans Pelicans.
Washington Wizards are struggling with a 2-5 record and coming off a 24-point loss to the Memphis Grizzlies.
Orlando Magic will be without star forward Paolo Banchero due to a torn right oblique.
Franz Wagner led the Magic with 27 points in their recent victory.
Jordan Poole is leading the Wizards' scoring with 20.7 points per game.
Wizards are dealing with injuries to key players like Kyle Kuzma and Malcolm Brogdon.
Bilal Coulibaly has shown promise, increasing his scoring average this season.
Bub Carrington, the 14th overall pick, has been contributing on both ends of the floor.
Alex Sarr, the second overall pick, is developing his game with 2.6 blocks per game.
Coach Jamahl Mosley emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense for the Magic.
Orlando Magic have won five of their last six home meetings against the Washington Wizards.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be aired on the FanDuel Sports Network Florida, with the radio broadcast available on 96.9 The Game.
